newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Kiwi dollar ends turbulent week in good spirits.
newsitem.headline: Kiwi dollar ends turbulent week in good spirits.

text.p: The New Zealand dollar closed a turbulent week firmer and in reasonable spirits, despite drifting off from its intra-session highs.

Dealers expected further volatility from the currency, but said its recovery from a low on Tuesday of US$0.6450 to its close on Friday at 0.6546/53, up from 0.6538/45 at the open, had improved general sentiment.
"The kiwi's very volatile at the moment. We've had some big ranges -- it's up and down like a yo-yo," said a bank chief dealer.
"But I think overall it looks okay at the moment, particularly with no rate cut in Australia today and the Aussie holding here nicely above US$0.7390.
"I would expect that the kiwi will remain volatile again tonight, but I think the downside should be limited to around 0.6525, with a move closer towards 0.6575 in the offing."
The New Zealand currency traded as high as 0.6565 this session but eased off towards the close.
"I think the local trading market was probably a little long looking for a retry of the overnight highs and they just got filled in and it's drifted off," said the chief dealer at another bank.

"But the volumes have been quite light. I would suggest that the general feeling is probably a little more upbeat, a bit more positive, given that kiwi's managed to recover nicely from its lows and really is closing pretty well bid," he said.
But the longer term trend, which has seen the kiwi fall from above 67.7 U.S. cents in a month, was still in place.
"We're just marking time and consolidating, because we saw some pretty considerable losses over a very short period of time," said a dealer.
"I think overall the trend still remains down."
The Trade-Weighted Index closed unchanged at 65.07.
